title: God's Protection and Deliverance
shortSummary: Psalm 91 is a profound declaration of God's protection and faithfulness to those who trust in Him. It assures believers of divine refuge, deliverance from danger, and the presence of angels to guard them through life's trials. This chapter encourages steadfast faith and reliance on God's power and promises.
timeline: Traditionally attributed to Moses or David, likely composed during the period of Israel's wilderness wanderings or early monarchy (c. 1400–1000 BC).

keyCharacters.name: The Psalmist
keyCharacters.description: The author who expresses confidence in God's protection and declares the blessings of trusting in the Lord.

keyCharacters.name: The LORD (Yahweh)
keyCharacters.description: The Most High God who provides refuge, protection, and deliverance to those who love and trust Him.

definitions.definition: A metaphor for intimate fellowship and trust in God’s presence, implying safety and concealment under His care.
A place of safety and protection; God is described as a fortress where believers find security from harm.
A trap set by hunters; symbolizing hidden dangers or temptations from which God delivers His people.
Defensive weapons used in battle; representing God's truth as a protective defense against spiritual and physical attacks.
Heavenly beings assigned by God to guard and assist believers, especially in times of danger.

outline.heading: The Assurance of God’s Protection
outline.description: The psalmist begins by affirming the security found in dwelling in God’s presence and declares the Lord as refuge and fortress, establishing the foundation of trust in God’s protective power.

outline.heading: God’s Deliverance from Danger
outline.description: This section details the various threats—traps, pestilence, terror, and destruction—from which God promises deliverance, emphasizing His power to protect even amid widespread calamity.

outline.heading: The Blessing of God’s Presence
outline.description: The psalmist explains that making God one’s refuge results in divine protection, including angelic guardianship and victory over deadly enemies symbolized by lions and serpents.

outline.heading: God’s Promise of Deliverance and Reward
outline.description: God Himself speaks, promising deliverance, answered prayer, presence in trouble, honor, long life, and salvation to those who love Him and know His name, highlighting the personal relationship between God and the believer.

application: Trust in God’s protection by cultivating a close, personal relationship with Him through prayer and obedience.
Rely on God’s promises during times of fear and uncertainty, remembering that He is a refuge and fortress.
Seek God’s presence daily to experience His peace and protection amid spiritual and physical dangers.
Call upon God in times of trouble with confidence that He will answer and deliver according to His faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone for the entire psalm, emphasizing the safety and security found in intimate fellowship with God.

keyVerses.text: He shall cover thee with his feathers, and under his wings shalt thou trust: his truth shall be thy shield and buckler.
keyVerses.significance: It uses the powerful imagery of a bird protecting its young to illustrate God’s tender yet strong protection over His people.

keyVerses.text: For he shall give his angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals God’s provision of angelic guardianship, assuring believers of divine protection in their daily lives.

keyVerses.text: Because he hath set his love upon me, therefore will I deliver him: I will set him on high, because he hath known my name.
keyVerses.significance: God’s personal promise to those who love Him, highlighting the intimate relationship and resulting deliverance and exaltation.
